item.title: Input Demand and Output Supply
item.description: Long Run Input Demand § def. Ordinary Input Demand. Ordinary Demand for Inputs (=labor l, capital k) To derive: Profit Function Properties: HD0 in (w,r,p) Decreasing in own-price ←regardless of anything! (Unlike Utility Maximization) def.

item.title: Institutional Design
item.description: Horizontal vs Vertical organization structure Centralized vs Decentralized (Microphysics of-) Microphysics of Power Incentives & Payoff structures in Game Theory .

item.title: Instruction Set
item.description: Instruction Set: a set of instructions—the “vocabulary”—that a process of certain architecture understands (x86, MIPS, etc.) Types of Instruction Set: ARMv7, ARMv8 (64-bit), MIPS, x86 (32, 64-bit).

item.title: Instructions (Computer Science)
item.description: 2.1. Introduction § Instruction Set language of the hardware. Vocabulary understood by a given architecture. 2.2. Operations of the Computer Hardware § Register: Places to store variables An instruction in MIPS looks like this: add $s1, $s2, $s3 which means s1 ← s2 + s3 Notice that one instruction has three operands.

item.title: Integer Multiplication
item.description: alg. Long Multiplication. (grade school) algorithm Complexity: Time O(n2). alg. Karatsuba Multiplication. Recursive algorithm to compute Idea: To get x×y… Let a,b,c,d be digits of x=abˉ,y=cdˉ, and observe: x=10n/2a+b y=10n/2c+d x×y=10nac+10n/2(ad+bc)+bd Recurse Compute a×c …(1) Recurse Compute b×d …(2) To compute the middle term, instead of computing a×d,b×c we do: Recursively compute (a+b)(c+d)=ac+ad+bc+bd …(3) (3) subtract (1) and (2) to get middle term ad+bc See Karatsuba Multiplication in 13 min - YouTube Complexity Time: O(nlog2​3≈n1.

item.title: Interest Rate
item.description: Rates in General § def. Rate is a simple abstraction of interest rate so that we can calculate things easily. R​=F(0)F(τ)−F(0)​=τ⋅r=(1+kr​)τk−1​ (Definition) (.

item.title: Jean Baudrillard
item.description: The postmodern condition (Postmodernism) def. Simulation btw. illusion problem!= simulation problem There is no way out of the simulation postmodern age: no longer a distinction between illusion and reality ⇒ this situation is a simulation “stranded in a world without referents” The desert of the real (everything scary about postmodernism!) “tribute to individuals which is property and function of the simulation” “the analyst of simulation, therefore, is subject to the very rule he or she analyzes” Simulation attempts to hypermarket def.
